TUMOUR_ID.description: Project specific ID for each tumour from Cancer Registry. As someone can have more than one tumour, a patient can have multiple unique tumour IDs. If not available in Cancer Registry consider from Flagging Cancers

DIAGNOSIS_DATE.description: Date of diagnosis from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from Flagging Cancers. If both are not available consider HistoPath_BrCa field if available in the order CoreDat, DateSpecimenTaken, DateSpecimenReceived, ReportDat. For Ovarian incidents if considering from HistoPath_OvCa follow the same rule as HistoPath_BrCa

AGE_AT_DIAGNOSIS.description: Age of the patient when they were diagnosed with the tumour in years from Cancer Registry

ICD_CODE.description: ICD code to describe the site of origin of the neoplasm from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from Flagging Cancers

ICD_CODE_3CHAR.description: 3 character ICD code that describes site of origin of the neoplasm from Cancer Registry

MORPH_CODE.description: Morphology of the cancer, in the ICD-10-O2 system from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BraCa

SITE.description: Site of the cancer derived usign SITE_CODED_DESC from Cancer Registry. For Ovarian cases, consider Primary_Site from HistoPath_OvCa

GRADE.description: Grade of the tumour from Cancer Registry. If not available consider Invasive Grade from HistoPath_BraCa. For Ovarian cases if not available in Cacner Registry, consider Grade_I_II_III from HistoPath_OvCa
enumDescriptions: GX : Grade of differentiation is not appropriate or cannot be assessed

TUMOUR_SIZE.description: Tumour Size in mm. from Cancer Registry. If not available consider Invasive Size from HistoPath_BrCa if not available consider DCIS size

NODES_TOTAL.description: The number of local and regional nodes reported as being positive from Cancer Registry. If not available, consider HistoPath_BrCa by adding fields AxillaryNodesPositive and OtherNodesPositive

NODES_POSITIVE.description: The number of local and regional nodes examined from Cancer Registry. If not available, consider HistoPath_BrCa by adding fields AxillaryNodesTotal and OtherNodesTotal

STAGE.description: Best stage at diagnosis of the tumour from Cancer Registry. If not available derive from HistoPath_BrCa using Tstage, Nstage, and Mstage. For Ovarian entries if not from Cancer Registry consider Stage_Best from HistoPath_OvCa

ER_STATUS.description: Oestrogen receptor status of the tumour from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

PR_STATUS.description: Progesterone receptor status of the tumour from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

HER2_STATUS.description: Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 (HER2) status of the tumour from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

Ki67.description: Ki67 % Positive nuclei as indicated in Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

SCREEN_DETECTED.description: Whether or not the tumour was detected by a screening programme from Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

LATERALITY.description: Identifies the side of the body for a tumour as indicated in Cancer Registry. If not available consider from HistoPath_BrCa

T_STAGE.description: The UICC code which classifies the size and extent of the primary tumour as indicated in Cancer Registry. If not available consider Tstage from HistoPath_BrCa

N_STAGE.description: The UICC code which classifies the absence or presence and extent of regional lymph node metastases as indicated in Cancer Registry. If not available consider Nstage from HistoPath_BrCa

M_STAGE.description: The UICC code which classifies the absence or presence of distant metastases as indicated in Cancer Registry. If not available consider Mstage from HistoPath_BrCa

SOURCE.description: Source of the tumour entry in the cancer summary table

DATE_CREATED.description: Date record created in the cancer summary table

COMMENTS.description: Additional notes for the tumour entry

OvCa_Variables.description: Please check if any other variables are required from HistoPath_OvCa schema
